column4: hmm.. how do I get sound from other gnome programs ( such as gaim ) than totem?
configure them to use esd
ok. but esd won't start since it uses /dev/dsp
hmm?
do sounds work correctly in warty?
no.. only in xmms and totem.. if I set them to use alsa..
what sound chipset do you use?
emu101k
oki.. but I have :)
/j #alsa
ok.. but with alsa it works per application basis.. not with "gnome"
what about when you tell everything to use esd by default?
esd wont start since there is no /dev/dsp
lsmod|grep snd_pcm_oss
but /dev/dsp exists
also, what does `cat /proc/asound/cards' tell you your sound card is?
card 0 is usb audio and 1 is my live card..
so switch the order
ok. how? by disconnection my cam?
echo "snd-emu10k1" | sudo tee -a /etc/modules && echo "snd-usb-audio" | sudo tee -a /etc/modules
now the sounds works. thanks!!. but shouldn't it be possible to tell gnome to use card x instead of card 0?
not presently
ok.. not by changing any config files manually either?
possibly in /etc/esound/esd.conf
